FILM
Chappaqua New Castle Community Television's short video and film festival awards ceremony and showcase. Jan. 27 at 7:30 p.m. Free. Chappaqua Library, 195 South Greeley Avenue. (914) 238-4779.
Mount Kisco ''An Inconvenient Truth,'' documentary by Al Gore. Thursday at 7 p.m. Free. Mount Kisco Public Library, 100 East Main Street. (914) 666-8041.
Nyack ''Half Nelson,'' directed by Ryan Fleck. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. $6 and $8. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.

Pleasantville ''50 Years of Janus Films,'' a series showcasing films by Bergman, Truffaut, Fellini, Kurosawa and others. Through Feb. 28. $6 to $13 per film; some films are followed by question-and-answer sessions. Schedule and information: burnsfilmcenter.org. FrameWorks: Art on Film Series: ''The Collector,'' documentary by Olympia Stone about her father, Allan, a Purchase gallery owner and collector who died in December; a question-and-answer session with Ms. Stone follows the screening. Wednesday at 7:15 p.m; sold out. Jacob Burns Film Center, 364 Manville Road. (914) 773-7663.
Poughkeepsie ''Monty Python and the Holy Grail.'' Friday at 7 p.m. $5. Bardavon 1869 Opera House, 35 Market Street. (845) 473-2072.
